net
Interface Network_iface

All Known Implementing Classes:
Example
public interface Network_iface

An instance of a class implementing this interface has to be passed to the constructor of Network. It will be used by Network to forward received messages, write to a log and take action when the connection is closed.

Author:
Raphael Blatter (raphael@blatter.sg)
See Also:
Network.Network(int, Network_iface, int)

Method Summary
 void networkDisconnected(int id)
          Is called when the network has been disconnected.
 void parseInput(int id, int numBytes, int[] message)
          Is called when sequence of bytes are received over the Serial interface.
 void writeLog(int id, java.lang.String text)
          Is called to write connection information to the log.
 

Method Detail

writeLog

void writeLog(int id,
              java.lang.String text)
Is called to write connection information to the log. The information can either be ignored, directed to stdout or written out to a specialized field or file in the program.

Parameters:
id - The int passed to Network.Network(int, Network_iface, int) in the constructor. It can be used to identify which instance (which connection) a message comes from, when several instances of Network are connected to the same instance of a class implementing this interface.
text - The text to be written into the log in human readable form. Corresponds to information about the connection or ports.

parseInput

void parseInput(int id,
                int numBytes,
                int[] message)
Is called when sequence of bytes are received over the Serial interface. It sends the bytes (as ints between 0 and 255) between the two Network.dividers passed via the constructor of Network ( Network.Network(int, Network_iface, int)), without the Network.dividers. Messages are only forwarded using this function, once a Network.divider has been recognized in the incoming stream.

Parameters:
id - The int passed to Network.Network(int, Network_iface, int) in the constructor. It can be used to identify which instance a message comes from, when several instances of Network are connected to the same instance of a class implementing this interface.
numBytes - Number of valid bytes contained in the message
message - Message received over the Serial interface. The complete array of bytes (as ints between 0 and 255) between Network.divider is sent (without Network.dividers).

networkDisconnected

void networkDisconnected(int id)
Is called when the network has been disconnected. This call can e.g. be used to show the connection status in a GUI or inform the user using other means.

Parameters:
id - Network.id of the corresponding Network instance (see Network.id).
